title: Why now is the perfect time to plan your winter-sun wardrobe
text:
Early October is the time to turn on the heat and unpack the knitwear. While I’d usually shove sunscreen-stained swimsuits and cover-up to the back of my wardrobe as fast as possible, this time I’m slowing down. I’ve decided that the October seasonal changeover is the ideal time to take stock of summer wardrobe choices - the bad (linen shorts, the colour yellow, bucket hats; let us never speak of these again), the good, and the very good, so good that I’m wistful about forcing them into hibernation.

I’ve decided that October is the ideal time to assess summer fashion past and plot winter-sun fashion to come. And by plan, I mean shop.
